description: This foundation course explores major principles of cellular and molecular biology and is a prerequisite for all Level II biology courses. Emphases include the structural and chemical composition of cells, crucial metabolic pathways, fundamentals of cell division, basic genetics and the scientific method. Labs integrate concepts with problem-solving and scientific writing. Students attend lectures plus one 2.5-hour laboratory per week. Taught annually and during Interim. GE: NST-B, NSL.
name: Cell Bio & Genetics
notes: Students in Bio 125D MUST also register for one lab Bio 125HL, IL or JL
title: Cellular Biology and Genetics
